title: Suppress syncing of certain password
content:
Hello,

firefox synchronizes my logins across all my devices which is nice and useful. However there are certain password (e.g. e-banking) I would prefer to store/remember only on my laptop where my drive is fully encrypted.

Is there a way to do so?

Thank you in advance.
creator: ospyros

title: Login credentials
content:
Some sites require hitting enter in the name field to show the credentials, especially when there are multiple logins. I would simply click enter on the desired username. Now when I hit enter, the credentials flash & then disappear. The same thing happens in the the search toolbar; auto-suggestions flash & then disappear. When using autofill in forms, the data flashes, but does not populate the field.

I even tried going back to an older version, but that didn't help. I was using 112.0

This is driving me nuts.

Thanks, Steve
creator: bizman909

title: è possibile far sì che cliccando sull'icona delle estensioni vengano mostrate quelle attivate e non si avvii la loro gestione ?
content: Vorrei avviare una delle estensioni attivate presenti scegliendola da un menù a cascata
creator: giannimmu

title: Most modern version of Firefox that will work on OS 10.10.15
content:
Hello,

I'm looking to download and run the most most recent version of Firefox that will work on a Mac running OS 10.10.15. Where can I find it, and is there anything special I need to make it work?

Thanks in advance.
creator: peaceful

title: Firefox Crashes after I exit.
content:
Firefox crashes every time I close it. It will slow down my entire system for a minute or two before the crash report screen will appear. This happens even in Troubleshoot Mode. I run the install file again and continue to have problems it is very difficult to work on since it slows down my entire system every time I test something.

Multiple Crash reports have been submitted - see Report ID bp-a3c46098-e2ff-46af-85a3-b23980230414 / CrashID 9ed7edd1-1420-4cad-8352-332380230413 or Report ID bp-7c9bff5f-afbf-4cd1-ab82-d50bd0230414/ Crash ID 7c9bff5f-afbf-4cd1-ab82-d50bd0230414
creator: verfam.firefoxsettings

title: Firefox V112 (64 bit) slow to load pages
content:
Hi all. Permit me to say thank you in advance to the people responding.

I am running a late 2010 MacBook Air, Firefox V 112 (64 bit), IOS 10.13.6. Search Engine is Duck Duck Go. Web pages have become very slow to load. Lower left hand part of the screen displays "waiting for Duck Duck Go, waiting for YouTube, etc." I have the same problem with a like vintage Lenovo V460 running Windows 10. It's not the router because my smartphone loads pages wicked fast and it uses my router for data. The phone is using Firefox Focus.

Changing the browser to Safari speeds loading. Changing the browser to Edge does the same for the Lenovo V460.

This problem began with both computers after Firefox recent updates, although I don't recall when it started. Suggestions? I have been a Firefox user since forever ago and I'd really like to keep using it.

Thanks again.

Allen.
creator: Allendotgreen

title: Intermittent loss of video quality while watching Spectrum TV.
content:
Using Firefox 112.0 on a Win 10 64bit HP Omen running an Nvidia GTX 1070 and 32GB ram onboard. When I go to watch tv in my office through https://watch.spectrum.net/livetv, the resolution will randomly just drop out to an unwatchable blurred mess. It may do it right off the bat when I open the link, or it may drop out minutes, or even hours into it. Bandwidth is not an issue, as I'm running WIFI 6 on the 5Ghz channel pulling an average Speedtest result of 220Mbps, with a ping of 12ms. Upload is an asymmetric ~12Mbps, but that's a moot point, I feel. There are no issues with YT, or watching Twitch. Running Firefox 112, Edge, Brave, and Chrome side by side to compare picture quality, surprisingly Firefox presents the clearest, sharpest video when it is rendering properly, which makes this a bit more frustrating. This loss of quality occurs to a lesser degree and frequency in Edge and Chrome, but I've yet to see it in Brave. So that leads me to think it might be a GPU setting. I've tried increasing several of the 'about:config' media.cache, browser.cache settings, disabled the browser.cache.disk.size.smart_enable, to no avail. I factory reset the Tp-Link Ac-1900, enabled/disabled all ALG protocols, switched between 20/40/80Mghz, adjusted RTS threshold everywhere between 500 to 2346. Enabled/disabled IGMP snooping. I also toggled/adjusted several of the MFAA, FXAA, anisotropic, shader cache size, etc within the Nvidia control panel. I feel I have a gremlin under the hood. Thank you for any suggestions or ideas! I love troubleshooting, but I'm gonna have to call in reinforcements on this one!

title: Scroll
content: Nem tudom görgetni az oldalakat az egérrel. Más böngészőknél működik a görgő, a Firefox-nál nem. Köszönöm a fáradságot! Üdv; Egyed Péter :)
creator: egyedpeter
